definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating

sentences.english: They let off their guns at the intruding enemy ships.
sentences.chinese: 我们向入侵敌舰的船头前开炮，迫使该舰停下。

sentences.english: The anti-aircraft units opened fire and hit two of the planes.
sentences.chinese: 防空部队开炮，击中了两架飞机。

sentences.english: The gunboat opened fire on the mainland.
Sloan said near the start of his postgame news conference.
sentences.chinese: 赛后新闻发布会开始不久，斯隆就开炮了。

sentences.english: His order was not to fire until the enemy planes presented a close and clear target.
sentences.chinese: 他的命令是要等敌机飞近日标明显时再开炮。

definition: to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
to bombard/to bomb/trad. also written 炮轟
big gun/cannon/artillery/one who talks big/trad. form 大炮 also used/CL:門|门[men2],尊[zun1]
to open fire/to shoot a gun
to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating
